<h1 class="firstHeading mw-first-heading" id="firstHeading">List of AMD graphics processing units</h1>
<div class="vector-body" id="bodyContent">
<div class="noprint" id="siteSub">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>
<div id="contentSub"></div>
<div id="contentSub2"></div>
<div id="jump-to-nav"></div>
<a class="mw-jump-link" href="#mw-head">Jump to navigation</a>
<a class="mw-jump-link" href="#searchInput">Jump to search</a>
<div class="mw-body-content mw-content-ltr" dir="ltr" id="mw-content-text" lang="en"><div class="mw-parser-output"><p>
The following is a list that contains general information about <a href="/wiki/Graphics_processing_unit" title="Graphics processing unit">GPUs</a> and video cards by <a href="/wiki/Advanced_Micro_Devices" title="Advanced Micro Devices">Advanced Micro Devices</a> (AMD), including those by <a href="/wiki/ATI_Technologies" title="ATI Technologies">ATI Technologies</a> before 2006, based on official specifications in table-form.
</p>
<div aria-labelledby="mw-toc-heading" class="toc" id="toc" role="navigation"><input class="toctogglecheckbox" id="toctogglecheckbox" role="button" style="display:none" type="checkbox"/><div class="toctitle" dir="ltr" lang="en"><h2 id="mw-toc-heading">Contents</h2><span class="toctogglespan"><label class="toctogglelabel" for="toctogglecheckbox"></label></span></div>

</div>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Field_explanations">Field explanations</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: Field explanations">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>The headers in the table listed below describe the following:
</p>
<ul><li><b>Model</b> – The marketing name for the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/GPU" title="GPU">GPU</a> assigned by <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/AMD" title="AMD">AMD</a>/<a href="/wiki/ATI_Technologies" title="ATI Technologies">ATI</a>. Note that ATI trademarks have been replaced by AMD trademarks starting with the <a href="/wiki/Radeon_HD_6000_series" title="Radeon HD 6000 series">Radeon HD 6000 series</a> for desktop and <a href="/wiki/AMD_FirePro" title="AMD FirePro">AMD FirePro</a> series for professional graphics.</li>
<li><b>Codename</b> – The internal engineering codename for the GPU.</li>
<li><b>Launch</b> – Date of release for the GPU.</li>
<li><b>Architecture</b> – The <a href="/wiki/Microarchitecture" title="Microarchitecture">microarchitecture</a> used by the GPU.</li>
<li><b>Fab</b> – Fabrication process. Average feature size of components of the GPU.</li>
<li><b>Transistors</b> – <a href="/wiki/Transistor_count" title="Transistor count">Number</a> of <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Transistors" title="Transistors">transistors</a> on the die.</li>
<li><b>Die Size</b> – Physical surface area of the die.</li>
<li><b>Core config</b> – The layout of the graphics pipeline, in terms of functional units.</li>
<li><b>Core clock</b> – The reference base and boost (if available) core clock frequency.</li>
<li><b>Fillrate</b>
<ul><li><b>Pixel</b> - The rate at which pixels can be rendered by the raster operators to a display. Measured in Pixels/s.</li>
<li><b>Texture</b> - The rate at which textures can be mapped by the texture mapping units onto a polygon mesh. Measured in Texels/s.</li></ul></li>
<li><b>Performance</b>
<ul><li><b>Shader operations</b> - How many operations the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Pixel_shader" title="Pixel shader">pixel shaders</a> (or <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Unified_shader" title="Unified shader">unified shaders</a> in <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Direct3D_10" title="Direct3D 10">Direct3D 10</a> and newer GPUs) can perform. Measured in Operations/s.</li>
<li><b>Vertex operations</b> - The amount of geometry operations that can be processed on the vertex shaders in one second (only applies to Direct3D 9.0c and older GPUs). Measured in Vertices/s.</li></ul></li>
<li><b>Memory</b>
<ul><li><b>Bus type</b> – Type of memory bus utilized.</li>
<li><b>Bus width</b> – Maximum bit width of the memory bus utilized.</li>
<li><b>Size</b> – Size of the graphics memory.</li>
<li><b>Clock</b> – The reference memory <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Clock_frequency" title="Clock frequency">clock frequency</a>.</li>
<li><b>Bandwidth</b> – Maximum theoretical <a href="/wiki/Memory_bandwidth" title="Memory bandwidth">memory bandwidth</a> based on bus type and width.</li></ul></li>
<li><b>TDP (<a href="/wiki/Thermal_design_power" title="Thermal design power">Thermal design power</a>)</b> – Maximum amount of heat generated by the GPU chip, measured in Watt.</li>
<li><b>TBP (Typical board power)</b> – Typical power drawn by the total board, including power for the GPU chip and peripheral equipment, such as <a href="/wiki/Voltage_regulator_module" title="Voltage regulator module">Voltage regulator module</a>, memory, fans, etc., measured in Watt.</li>
<li><b>Bus interface</b> – Bus by which the graphics processor is attached to the system (typically an expansion slot, such as <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Conventional_PCI" title="Conventional PCI">PCI</a>, <a href="/wiki/Accelerated_Graphics_Port" title="Accelerated Graphics Port">AGP</a>, or <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/PCIe" title="PCIe">PCIe</a>).</li>
<li><b>API support</b> – Rendering and computing <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Application_programming_interface" title="Application programming interface">APIs</a> supported by the GPU and driver.</li></ul>
<p><b>Due to conventions changing over time, some numerical definitions such as core config, core clock, performance and memory should not be compared one-to-one across generations. The following tables are for reference use only, and do not reflect actual performance.</b>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Video_codec_acceleration">Video codec acceleration</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: Video codec acceleration">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<ul><li><b><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ATi_Radeon_R100_Series" title="ATi Radeon R100 Series">R100</a></b> - <a href="/wiki/Video_Immersion" title="Video Immersion">Video Immersion</a></li>
<li><b><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ATI_Radeon_R200_series" title="ATI Radeon R200 series">R200</a></b> - Video Immersion II</li>
<li><b><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ATi_Radeon_R300_Series" title="ATi Radeon R300 Series">R300</a></b> - Video Immersion II + <a href="/wiki/Video_Shader" title="Video Shader">Video Shader</a></li>
<li><b><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ATi_Radeon_R400_Series" title="ATi Radeon R400 Series">R410</a></b> - Video Shader HD</li>
<li><b><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ATi_Radeon_R400_Series" title="ATi Radeon R400 Series">R420</a></b> - Video Shader HD + <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/DXVA" title="DXVA">DXVA</a></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Radeon_X1000_series" title="Radeon X1000 series">R520</a></b> - <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Avivo" title="Avivo">Avivo Video</a></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Radeon_HD_2000_series" title="Radeon HD 2000 series">R600</a></b> - <a href="/wiki/ATI_Avivo#ATI_Avivo_HD" title="ATI Avivo">Avivo HD</a> - <a href="/wiki/Unified_Video_Decoder#UVD/UVD+" title="Unified Video Decoder">UVD</a> 1.0</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Radeon_HD_4000_series" title="Radeon HD 4000 series">R700</a></b> - <a href="/wiki/Unified_Video_Decoder#UVD_2" title="Unified Video Decoder">UVD 2</a>, UVD 2.2</li>
<li><b><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Radeon_HD_5000_Series" title="Radeon HD 5000 Series">Evergreen</a></b> - <a href="/wiki/Unified_Video_Decoder#UVD_2" title="Unified Video Decoder">UVD 2.2</a></li>
<li><b><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Radeon_HD_6000_Series" title="Radeon HD 6000 Series">Northern Islands</a></b> - <a href="/wiki/Unified_Video_Decoder#UVD_3" title="Unified Video Decoder">UVD 3</a> (HD 67xx <a href="/wiki/Unified_Video_Decoder#UVD_2" title="Unified Video Decoder">UVD 2.2</a>)</li>
<li><b><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Radeon_HD_7000_Series" title="Radeon HD 7000 Series">Southern Islands</a></b> - UVD 3.1, <a href="/wiki/Video_Coding_Engine#VCE_1.0" title="Video Coding Engine">VCE 1.0</a></li>
<li><b><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/AMD_Radeon_Rx_200_series" title="AMD Radeon Rx 200 series">Sea Islands</a></b> - <a href="/wiki/Unified_Video_Decoder#UVD_4" title="Unified Video Decoder">UVD 4.2</a>, <a href="/wiki/Video_Coding_Engine#VCE_2.0" title="Video Coding Engine">VCE 2.0</a></li>
<li><b><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/AMD_Radeon_Rx_300_series" title="AMD Radeon Rx 300 series">Volcanic Islands</a></b> - <a href="/wiki/Unified_Video_Decoder#UVD_5" title="Unified Video Decoder">UVD 5.0</a>, <a href="/wiki/Unified_Video_Decoder#UVD_6" title="Unified Video Decoder">6.0</a>, <a href="/wiki/Video_Coding_Engine#VCE_3.0" title="Video Coding Engine">VCE 3.0</a></li>
<li><b><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/AMD_Radeon_400_series" title="AMD Radeon 400 series">Arctic Islands</a></b> - <a href="/wiki/Unified_Video_Decoder#UVD_6" title="Unified Video Decoder">UVD 6.3</a>, <a href="/wiki/Video_Coding_Engine#VCE_3.0" title="Video Coding Engine">VCE 3.4</a></li>
<li><b><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/AMD_RX_Vega_series" title="AMD RX Vega series">Vega</a></b> - <a href="/wiki/Unified_Video_Decoder#UVD_7" title="Unified Video Decoder">UVD 7.0</a>, <a href="/wiki/Video_Coding_Engine#VCE_4.0" title="Video Coding Engine">VCE 4.0</a> and <a href="/wiki/Video_Core_Next" title="Video Core Next">VCN 1.0</a> only at <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/AMD_Raven_Ridge" title="AMD Raven Ridge">AMD Raven Ridge</a></li>
<li><b><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/AMD_Radeon_RX_5000_series" title="AMD Radeon RX 5000 series">Navi 1X</a></b> - <a href="/wiki/Video_Core_Next" title="Video Core Next">VCN 2.0</a></li>
<li><b><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/AMD_Radeon_RX_6000_series" title="AMD Radeon RX 6000 series">Navi 2X</a></b> - <a href="/wiki/Video_Core_Next" title="Video Core Next">VCN 3.0</a></li></ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Features_Overview">Features Overview</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: Features Overview">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>
The following table shows features of <a href="/wiki/Advanced_Micro_Devices" title="Advanced Micro Devices">AMD</a>/<a href="/wiki/ATI_Technologies" title="ATI Technologies">ATI</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Graphics_processing_unit" title="Graphics processing unit">GPUs</a>
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div><style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1063604349">.mw-parser-output .navbar{display:inline;font-size:88%;font-weight:normal}.mw-parser-output .navbar-collapse{float:left;text-align:left}.mw-parser-output .navbar-boxtext{word-spacing:0}.mw-parser-output .navbar ul{display:inline-block;white-space:nowrap;line-height:inherit}.mw-parser-output .navbar-brackets::before{margin-right:-0.125em;content:"[ "}.mw-parser-output .navbar-brackets::after{margin-left:-0.125em;content:" ]"}.mw-parser-output .navbar li{word-spacing:-0.125em}.mw-parser-output .navbar a>span,.mw-parser-output .navbar a>abbr{text-decoration:inherit}.mw-parser-output .navbar-mini abbr{font-variant:small-caps;border-bottom:none;text-decoration:none;cursor:inherit}.mw-parser-output .navbar-ct-full{font-size:114%;margin:0 7em}.mw-parser-output .navbar-ct-mini{font-size:114%;margin:0 4em}</style><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist" style="position: relative; bottom: -11px;"><span>[ <span class="noprint plainlinks"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:AMD_GPU_features&amp;veaction=edit"><span title="Edit this template with the VE. <th class="table-rh" style="background: #ececec; color: black; font-weight: bold; vertical-align: middle; text-align: left;"><a href="/wiki/Direct3D" title="Direct3D">Direct3D</a>
</th>
<td class="table-na" colspan="2" data-sort-value="" style="background: #ececec; color: #2C2C2C; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;">N/A
</td>
<td>5.0
</td>
<td colspan="2">6.0
</td>
<td>7.0
</td>
<td>8.1
</td>
<td>9.0<br/>11 (<a href="/wiki/Feature_levels_in_Direct3D#Direct3D_11" title="Feature levels in Direct3D">9_2</a>)
</td>
<td>9.0b<br/>11 (<a href="/wiki/Feature_levels_in_Direct3D#Direct3D_11" title="Feature levels in Direct3D">9_2</a>)
</td>
<td>9.0c<br/>11 (<a href="/wiki/Feature_levels_in_Direct3D#Direct3D_11" title="Feature levels in Direct3D">9_3</a>)
</td>
<td>10.0<br/>11 (<a href="/wiki/Feature_levels_in_Direct3D#Direct3D_11" title="Feature levels in Direct3D">10_0</a>)
</td>
<td colspan="2">10.1<br/>11 (<a href="/wiki/Feature_levels_in_Direct3D#Direct3D_11" title="Feature levels in Direct3D">10_1</a>)
</td>
<td colspan="2">11 (<a href="/wiki/Feature_levels_in_Direct3D#Direct3D_11" title="Feature levels in Direct3D">11_0</a>)

<td class="table-yes2" colspan="5" data-sort-value="Yes" style="background: #DFD; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;"><img alt="Yes" data-file-height="600" data-file-width="600" decoding="async" height="13" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/f/fb/Yes_check.svg/13px-Yes_check.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/f/fb/Yes_check.svg/20px-Yes_check.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/f/fb/Yes_check.svg/26px-Yes_check.svg.png 2x" title="Yes" width="13"/>

<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1011085734">.mw-parser-output .reflist{font-size:90%;margin-bottom:0.5em;list-style-type:decimal}.mw-parser-output .reflist .references{font-size:100%;margin-bottom:0;list-style-type:inherit}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-2{column-width:30em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-3{column-width:25em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns{margin-top:0.3em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns ol{margin-top:0}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns li{page-break-inside:avoid;break-inside:avoid-column}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-alpha{list-style-type:upper-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-roman{list-style-type:upper-roman}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-alpha{list-style-type:lower-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-greek{list-style-type:lower-greek}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-roman{list-style-type:lower-roman}</style><div class="reflist reflist-lower-alpha">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-r100_shader-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-r100_shader_1-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The Radeon 100 Series has programmable pixel shaders, but do not fully comply with DirectX 8 or Pixel Shader 1.0. See article on <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ATi_Radeon_R100_Series#R100's_pixel_shaders" title="ATi Radeon R100 Series">R100's pixel shaders</a>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-nonpot-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-nonpot_2-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">R300, R400 and R500 based cards do not fully comply with OpenGL 2+ as the hardware does not support all types of non-power of two (NPOT) textures.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-nofp64-7"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-nofp64_7-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">OpenGL 4+ compliance requires supporting FP64 shaders and these are emulated on some TeraScale chips using 32-bit hardware.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-vcn-10"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-vcn_10-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-vcn_10-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-vcn_10-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">The UVD and VCE were replaced by the Video Core Next (VCN) ASIC in the <a href="/wiki/Ryzen#Raven_Ridge" title="Ryzen">Raven Ridge</a> APU implementation of Vega.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FliudMotion-12"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FliudMotion_12-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Video processing ASIC for video frame rate interpolation technique. In Windows it works as a DirectShow filter in your player. In Linux, there is no support on the part of drivers and / or community.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-DRM-13"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-DRM_13-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-DRM_13-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">To play protected video content, it also requires card, operating system, driver, and application support. A compatible HDCP display is also needed for this. HDCP is mandatory for the output of certain audio formats, placing additional constraints on the multimedia setup.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-max_displays-14"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-max_displays_14-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">More displays may be supported with native <a href="/wiki/DisplayPort" title="DisplayPort">DisplayPort</a> connections, or splitting the maximum resolution between multiple monitors with active converters.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-drm-16"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-drm_16-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-drm_16-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">DRM (<a href="/wiki/Direct_Rendering_Manager" title="Direct Rendering Manager">Direct Rendering Manager</a>) is a component of the Linux kernel. <a href="/wiki/AMDgpu_(Linux_kernel_module)" title="AMDgpu (Linux kernel module)">AMDgpu</a> is the Linux kernel module. Support in this table refers to the most current version.</span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="API_Overview">API Overview</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" title="Edit section: API Overview">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>The following table shows the graphics and compute <a href="/wiki/API" title="API">APIs</a> support across AMD GPU micro-architectures. Note that  a branding series might include older generation chips.
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist" style="position: relative; bottom: -11px;"><span>[ <span class="noprint plainlinks"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:AMD_graphics_API_support&amp;veaction=edit"><span title="Edit this template with the VE. (Doesn't work if new wikitext mode is enabled.)">VisualEditor</span></a></span> ] </span><ul class="navbar-brackets"><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:AMD_graphics_API_support" title="Template:AMD graphics API support"><span title="View this template">view</span></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:AMD_graphics_API_support" title="Template talk:AMD graphics API support"><span title="Discuss this template">talk</span></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:AMD_graphics_API_support&amp;action=edit"><span title="Edit this template">edit</span></a></li></ul></div>

<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011085734" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="reflist reflist-lower-alpha">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-r100_shader-20"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-r100_shader_20-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Radeon 7000 Series has programmable pixel shaders, but do not fully comply with DirectX 8 or Pixel Shader 1.0. See article on <a href="/wiki/Radeon_R100_series#R100's_pixel_shaders" title="Radeon R100 series">R100's pixel shaders</a>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-nonpot-21"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-nonpot_21-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">These series do not fully comply with OpenGL 2+ as the hardware does not support all types of non-power-of-two (NPOT) textures.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-nofp64-23"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-nofp64_23-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">OpenGL 4+ compliance requires supporting FP64 shaders and these are emulated on some TeraScale chips using 32-bit hardware.</span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>
<p><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-THWGCN_24-0"><a href="#cite_note-THWGCN-24">[13]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-THW_radeon_8000_plans_25-0"><a href="#cite_note-THW_radeon_8000_plans-25">[14]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Radeon_VEGA_Frontier_Edition_26-0"><a href="#cite_note-Radeon_VEGA_Frontier_Edition-26">[15]</a></sup>
</p>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Mach_series">Mach series</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7" title="Edit section: Mach series">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Radeon_7000_series">Radeon 7000 series</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9" title="Edit section: Radeon 7000 series">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Radeon_R100_series" title="Radeon R100 series">Radeon R100 series</a></div>
<ul><li>All models include Direct3D 7.0 and <a href="/wiki/OpenGL" title="OpenGL">OpenGL</a> 1.3</li>
<li>The R100 cards were originally launched without any numbering as Radeon SDR, DDR, LE and VE; these products were later "rebranded" to their names within the numbered naming scheme, when the <a href="/wiki/List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units#Radeon_8000_&amp;_9000_series" title="List of AMD graphics processing units">Radeon 8000 series</a> was introduced.</li></ul>

<h4><span id="IGP_.283xx_series.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="IGP_(3xx_series)">IGP (3xx series)</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10" title="Edit section: IGP (3xx series)">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<ul><li>All models are manufactured with a 180 nm fabrication process</li>
<li>All models include Direct3D 7.0 and <a href="/wiki/OpenGL" title="OpenGL">OpenGL</a> 1.3</li>
<li>Based on the Radeon VE</li></ul>

<h3><span id="Radeon_8000_.26_9000_series"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Radeon_8000_&amp;_9000_series">Radeon 8000 &amp; 9000 series</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11" title="Edit section: Radeon 8000 &amp; 9000 series">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Radeon_R200_series" title="Radeon R200 series">Radeon R200 series</a></div>
<ul><li>All models are manufactured with a 150 nm fabrication process</li>
<li>All models include Direct3D 8.1 and <a href="/wiki/OpenGL" title="OpenGL">OpenGL</a> 1.4</li></ul>
<table class="wikitable" style="font-size:85%; text-align:center;">

<th class="table-rh" style="background: #ececec; color: black; font-weight: bold; vertical-align: middle; text-align: left;">Radeon 8500

<h4><span id="IGP_.289000_series.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="IGP_(9000_series)">IGP (9000 series)</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12" title="Edit section: IGP (9000 series)">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<ul><li>All models are manufactured with a 150 nm fabrication process</li>
<li>All models include Direct3D 8.1 and <a href="/wiki/OpenGL" title="OpenGL">OpenGL</a> 1.4</li>
<li>Based on the Radeon 9200</li></ul>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Radeon_R300_series">Radeon R300 series</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13" title="Edit section: Radeon R300 series">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span id="AGP_.289000_series.2C_X1000_series.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="AGP_(9000_series,_X1000_series)">AGP (9000 series, X1000 series)</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=14" title="Edit section: AGP (9000 series, X1000 series)">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Radeon_R300_series" title="Radeon R300 series">Radeon R300 series</a></div>
<ul><li>All models include Direct3D 9.0 and <a href="/wiki/OpenGL" title="OpenGL">OpenGL</a> 2.0</li>
<li>All models use an AGP 8x interface</li></ul>

<h4><span id="PCI-E_.28X3xx.2C_X5xx.2C_X6xx.2C_X1000_series.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="PCI-E_(X3xx,_X5xx,_X6xx,_X1000_series)">PCI-E (X3xx, X5xx, X6xx, X1000 series)</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=15" title="Edit section: PCI-E (X3xx, X5xx, X6xx, X1000 series)">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>

<h3><span id="Radeon_X700_.26_X800_series"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Radeon_X700_&amp;_X800_series">Radeon X700 &amp; X800 series</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=17" title="Edit section: Radeon X700 &amp; X800 series">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>

<h4><span id="PCI-E_.28X5xx.2C_X7xx.2C_X8xx.2C_X1000_series.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="PCI-E_(X5xx,_X7xx,_X8xx,_X1000_series)">PCI-E (X5xx, X7xx, X8xx, X1000 series)</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=19" title="Edit section: PCI-E (X5xx, X7xx, X8xx, X1000 series)">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Radeon_R400_series" title="Radeon R400 series">Radeon R400 series</a></div>
<ul><li>All models include <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/PCIe" title="PCIe">PCI-E</a> x16</li>
<li>All models include Direct3D 9.0b and <a href="/wiki/OpenGL" title="OpenGL">OpenGL</a> 2.0</li></ul>

<h4><span id="IGP_.28X12xx.2C_21xx.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="IGP_(X12xx,_21xx)">IGP (X12xx, 21xx)</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=20" title="Edit section: IGP (X12xx, 21xx)">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Radeon_R400_series" title="Radeon R400 series">Radeon R400 series</a></div>
<ul><li>All models include Direct3D 9.0b and <a href="/wiki/OpenGL" title="OpenGL">OpenGL</a> 2.0</li>
<li>Based on Radeon X700</li></ul>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Radeon_X1000_series">Radeon X1000 series</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=21" title="Edit section: Radeon X1000 series">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Radeon_X1000_series" title="Radeon X1000 series">Radeon X1000 series</a></div>
<ul><li>Note that ATI X1000 series cards (e.g. X1900) don't have Vertex Texture Fetch, hence they do not fully comply with the VS 3.0 model. Instead, they offer a feature called "Render to Vertex Buffer (R2VB)" that provides functionality that is an alternative Vertex Texture Fetch.</li></ul>

<h4><span id="IGP_.28HD_3000.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="IGP_(HD_3000)">IGP (HD 3000)</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=24" title="Edit section: IGP (HD 3000)">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Main article: <a href="/wiki/AMD_700_chipset_series#Integrated_graphics" title="AMD 700 chipset series">AMD 700 chipset series</a></div>
<ul><li>All Radeon HD 3000 IGP models include Direct3D 10.0 and <a href="/wiki/OpenGL" title="OpenGL">OpenGL</a> 3.3</li></ul>

</td>

</td>

<td>56
</td>

<p><sup>1</sup> <a href="/wiki/Unified_shader_model" title="Unified shader model">Unified shaders</a> : <a href="/wiki/Texture_mapping_unit" title="Texture mapping unit">Texture mapping units</a> : <a href="/wiki/Render_output_unit" title="Render output unit">Render output units</a>
<br/><sup>2</sup> The clock frequencies may vary in different usage scenarios, as <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ATI_PowerPlay" title="ATI PowerPlay">ATI PowerPlay</a> technology is implemented. The clock frequencies listed here refer to the officially announced clock specifications.
<br/><sup>3</sup> The sideport is a dedicated memory bus. It is preferably used for a <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Frame_buffer" title="Frame buffer">frame buffer</a>.
</p>

<p><sup>1</sup> <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Unified_Shader_Model" title="Unified Shader Model">Unified shaders</a> : <a href="/wiki/Texture_mapping_unit" title="Texture mapping unit">Texture mapping units</a> : <a href="/wiki/Render_output_unit" title="Render output unit">Render output units</a>
<br/><sup>2</sup> The effective data transfer rate of GDDR5 is quadruple its nominal clock, instead of double as it is with other DDR memory.
<br/><sup>3</sup> The TDP is reference design TDP values from AMD. Different non-reference board designs from vendors may lead to slight variations in actual TDP.
<br/><sup>4</sup> All models feature <a href="/wiki/Unified_Video_Decoder" title="Unified Video Decoder">UVD2</a> &amp; <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ATI_PowerPlay" title="ATI PowerPlay">PowerPlay</a>.
</p>
<h4><span id="IGP_.28HD_4000.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="IGP_(HD_4000)">IGP (HD 4000)</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=27" title="Edit section: IGP (HD 4000)">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Main articles: <a href="/wiki/AMD_700_chipset_series#Integrated_graphics" title="AMD 700 chipset series">AMD 700 chipset series</a> and <a href="/wiki/TeraScale_(microarchitecture)#TeraScale_1" title="TeraScale (microarchitecture)">TeraScale 1</a></div>
<ul><li>All Radeon HD 4000 IGP models include Direct3D 10.1 and OpenGL 2.0<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-39"><a href="#cite_note-39">[28]</a></sup></li></ul>
<table class="wikitable" style="font-size:85%; text-align:center;">

<p><sup>1</sup> <a href="/wiki/Unified_shader_model" title="Unified shader model">Unified shaders</a> : <a href="/wiki/Texture_mapping_unit" title="Texture mapping unit">Texture mapping units</a> : <a href="/wiki/Render_output_unit" title="Render output unit">Render output units</a>
<br/><sup>2</sup> The clock frequencies may vary in different usage scenarios, as <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ATI_PowerPlay" title="ATI PowerPlay">ATI PowerPlay</a> technology is implemented. The clock frequencies listed here refer to the officially announced clock specifications.
<br/><sup>3</sup> The sideport is a dedicated memory bus. It preferably used for <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Frame_buffer" title="Frame buffer">frame buffer</a>.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Radeon_HD_5000_series">Radeon HD 5000 series</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=28" title="Edit section: Radeon HD 5000 series">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Main articles: <a href="/wiki/Radeon_HD_5000_series" title="Radeon HD 5000 series">Radeon HD 5000 series</a> and <a href="/wiki/TeraScale_(microarchitecture)#TeraScale_2" title="TeraScale (microarchitecture)">TeraScale 2</a></div>
<ul><li>The HD5000 series is the last series of AMD GPUs which supports two analog <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Cathode_ray_tube" title="Cathode ray tube">CRT</a>-monitors with a single graphics card (i.e. with two RAM-DACs) <a href="/wiki/AMD_Eyefinity" title="AMD Eyefinity">AMD Eyefinity</a> introduced.</li></ul>
<div style="clear:both;"></div><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist" style="position: relative; bottom: -11px;"><span>[ <span class="noprint plainlinks"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:AMD_Radeon_HD_5xxx&amp;veaction=edit"><span title="Edit this template with the VE. <div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-a-40"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-a_40-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-a_40-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Unified_shader_model" title="Unified shader model">Unified Shaders</a> : <a href="/wiki/Texture_mapping_unit" title="Texture mapping unit">Texture Mapping Units</a> : <a href="/wiki/Render_output_unit" title="Render output unit">Render Output Units</a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-TDP-41"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-TDP_41-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-TDP_41-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">The TDP is reference design TDP values from AMD. Different non-reference board designs from vendors may lead to slight variations in actual TDP.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Eyefinity-42"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Eyefinity_42-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">All chips feature <i><a href="/wiki/AMD_Eyefinity" title="AMD Eyefinity">AMD Eyefinity</a></i>, but the Radeon HD 5870 Eyefinity Edition card also have six <a href="/wiki/Mini_DisplayPort" title="Mini DisplayPort">mini DisplayPort</a> outputs, all of which can be simultaneously active.</span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Radeon_HD_6000_series">Radeon HD 6000 series</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=29" title="Edit section: Radeon HD 6000 series">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Main articles: <a href="/wiki/Radeon_HD_6000_series" title="Radeon HD 6000 series">Radeon HD 6000 series</a> and <a href="/wiki/TeraScale_(microarchitecture)#TeraScale_3" title="TeraScale (microarchitecture)">TeraScale 3 (VLIW4)</a></div><p>• The Radeon HD 6000 series has a new tesselation engine which is said to double the performance when working with tesselation compared to the previous HD 5000 series.
</p><table class="wikitable" style="font-size: 90%; text-align: center">

<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini" style="float: left;position: relative;top: -15px;right: 5px;"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:AMD_Radeon_HD_6xxx_(Desktop)" title="Template:AMD Radeon HD 6xxx (Desktop)"><abbr title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:AMD_Radeon_HD_6xxx_(Desktop)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Template talk:AMD Radeon HD 6xxx (Desktop) (page does not exist)"><abbr title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:AMD_Radeon_HD_6xxx_(Desktop)&amp;action=edit"><abbr title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011085734" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="reflist reflist-lower-alpha">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-texture_fill-44"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-texture_fill_44-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Texture fillrate is calculated as the number of <b>Texture Mapping Units</b> multiplied by the base (or boost) core clock speed.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-pixel_fill-45"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-pixel_fill_45-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Pixel fillrate is calculated as the number of <b>Render Output Units</b> multiplied by the base (or boost) core clock speed.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FLOPS-46"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FLOPS_46-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Precision performance is calculated from the base (or boost) core clock speed based on a <a href="/wiki/Multiply%E2%80%93accumulate_operation#Fused_multiply–add" title="Multiply–accumulate operation">FMA</a> operation.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-GDDR5_transfer_rate-47"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-GDDR5_transfer_rate_47-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The effective data transfer rate of <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/GDDR5" title="GDDR5">GDDR5</a> is quadruple its nominal clock, instead of double as it is with DDR memory.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-cconfig-48"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-cconfig_48-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Unified_shader_model" title="Unified shader model">Unified Shaders</a> : <a href="/wiki/Texture_mapping_unit" title="Texture mapping unit">Texture Mapping Units</a> : <a href="/wiki/Render_output_unit" title="Render output unit">Render Output Units</a></span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>
<p><br/>
</p>
<h4><span id="IGP_.28HD_6000.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="IGP_(HD_6000)">IGP (HD 6000)</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=30" title="Edit section: IGP (HD 6000)">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<ul><li>All models feature the UNB/MC Bus interface</li>
<li>All models do <b>not</b> feature double-precision FP</li>
<li>With driver Update OpenGL 4.4 available (Last Catalyst 15.12). OpenGL 4.5 available with Crimson Beta (driver version 15.30 or higher).</li>
<li>All models feature Angle independent anisotropic filtering, UVD3, and <a href="/wiki/AMD_Eyefinity" title="AMD Eyefinity">AMD Eyefinity</a> capabilities, with up to three outputs.</li>
<li>All models feature 3D Blu-ray Disc acceleration.</li></ul>
<div style="clear:both;"></div><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist" style="position: relative; bottom: -11px;"><span>[ <span class="noprint plainlinks"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:AMD_Radeon_HD_6xxxD&amp;veaction=edit"><span title="Edit this template with the VE. (Doesn't work if new wikitext mode is enabled.)">VisualEditor</span></a></span> ] </span><ul class="navbar-brackets"><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:AMD_Radeon_HD_6xxxD" title="Template:AMD Radeon HD 6xxxD"><span title="View this template">view</span></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:AMD_Radeon_HD_6xxxD&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Template talk:AMD Radeon HD 6xxxD (page does not exist)"><span title="Discuss this template">talk</span></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:AMD_Radeon_HD_6xxxD&amp;action=edit"><span title="Edit this template">edit</span></a></li></ul></div>
<ul><li>Embedded GPU's as part of AMD's <a href='/wiki/List_of_AMD_accelerated_processing_units#Lynx:_"Llano"_(2011)' title="List of AMD accelerated processing units">Lynx</a> platform APU's.</li></ul>

<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-a-49"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-a_49-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Unified_shader_model" title="Unified shader model">Unified Shaders</a> : <a href="/wiki/Texture_mapping_unit" title="Texture mapping unit">Texture Mapping Units</a> : <a href="/wiki/Render_output_unit" title="Render output unit">Render Output Units</a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-TDP-50"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-TDP_50-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">TDP specified for AMD reference designs, includes CPU power consumption. Actual TDP of retail products may vary.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-c-51"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-c_51-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">A4-3300 series runs the Radeon HD 6410D at a speed of 443 MHz. Remaining A4 series run at 600 MHz.</span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Radeon_HD_7000_series">Radeon HD 7000 series</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=31" title="Edit section: Radeon HD 7000 series">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>

</th></tr></tbody></table>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011085734" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="reflist reflist-lower-alpha">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-boost-52"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-boost_52-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_52-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_52-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_52-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_52-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_52-5"><sup><i><b>f</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Boost values (if available) are stated below the base value in <i>italic</i>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-texture_fill-53"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-texture_fill_53-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-texture_fill_53-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Texture fillrate is calculated as the number of <b>Texture Mapping Units</b> multiplied by the base (or boost) core clock speed.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-pixel_fill-54"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-pixel_fill_54-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-pixel_fill_54-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Pixel fillrate is calculated as the number of <b>Render Output Units</b> multiplied by the base (or boost) core clock speed.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FLOPS-55"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-FLOPS_55-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FLOPS_55-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Precision performance is calculated from the base (or boost) core clock speed based on a <a href="/wiki/Multiply%E2%80%93accumulate_operation#Fused_multiply–add" title="Multiply–accumulate operation">FMA</a> operation.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-GDDR5_transfer_rate-56"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-GDDR5_transfer_rate_56-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-GDDR5_transfer_rate_56-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">The effective data transfer rate of <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/GDDR5" title="GDDR5">GDDR5</a> is quadruple its nominal clock, instead of double as it is with DDR memory.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-cconfig-57"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-cconfig_57-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-cconfig_57-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Unified_shader_model" title="Unified shader model">Unified Shaders</a> : <a href="/wiki/Texture_mapping_unit" title="Texture mapping unit">Texture Mapping Units</a> : <a href="/wiki/Render_output_unit" title="Render output unit">Render Output Units</a></span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>
<p><br/>
</p>
<h4><span id="IGP_.28HD_7000.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="IGP_(HD_7000)">IGP (HD 7000)</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=32" title="Edit section: IGP (HD 7000)">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<ul><li>All models feature the UNB/MC Bus interface</li>
<li>All models do <b>not</b> support double-precision FP</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/TeraScale_(microarchitecture)#TeraScale_2" title="TeraScale (microarchitecture)">TeraScale 2 (VLIW5)</a> based APUs feature angle independent anisotropic filtering, UVD3, and <a href="/wiki/AMD_Eyefinity" title="AMD Eyefinity">Eyefinity</a> capabilities, with up to three outputs.</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/TeraScale_(microarchitecture)#TeraScale_3" title="TeraScale (microarchitecture)">TeraScale 3 (VLIW4)</a> based APUs feature angle independent anisotropic filtering, UVD3.2, and <a href="/wiki/AMD_Eyefinity" title="AMD Eyefinity">Eyefinity</a> capabilities, with up to four outputs.</li></ul>
<div style="clear:both;"></div><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist" style="position: relative; bottom: -11px;"><span>[ <span class="noprint plainlinks"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:AMD_Radeon_HD_7xxxD&amp;veaction=edit"><span title="Edit this template with the VE. (Doesn't work if new wikitext mode is enabled.)">VisualEditor</span></a></span> ] </span><ul class="navbar-brackets"><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:AMD_Radeon_HD_7xxxD" title="Template:AMD Radeon HD 7xxxD"><span title="View this template">view</span></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:AMD_Radeon_HD_7xxxD&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Template talk:AMD Radeon HD 7xxxD (page does not exist)"><span title="Discuss this template">talk</span></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:AMD_Radeon_HD_7xxxD&amp;action=edit"><span title="Edit this template">edit</span></a></li></ul></div>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Radeon_HD_8000_series">Radeon HD 8000 series</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_AMD_graphics_processing_units&amp;action=edit&amp;section=33" title="Edit section: Radeon HD 8000 series">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Main articles: <a href="/wiki/Radeon_HD_8000_series" title="Radeon HD 8000 series">Radeon HD 8000 series</a> and <a href="/wiki/Graphics_Core_Next#first" title="Graphics Core Next">Graphics Core Next § first</a></div>
<div style="clear:both;"></div><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist" style="position: relative; bottom: -11px;"><span>[ <span class="noprint plainlinks"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:AMD_Radeon_HD_8xxx&amp;veaction=edit"><span title="Edit this template with the VE. (Doesn't work if new wikitext mode is enabled.)">VisualEditor</span></a></span> ] </span><ul class="navbar-brackets"><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:AMD_Radeon_HD_8xxx" title="Template:AMD Radeon HD 8xxx"><span title="View this template">view</span></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:AMD_Radeon_HD_8xxx&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Template talk:AMD Radeon HD 8xxx (page does not exist)"><span title="Discuss this template">talk</span></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:AMD_Radeon_HD_8xxx&amp;action=edit"><span title="Edit this template">edit</span></a></li></ul></div>

<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011085734" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="reflist reflist-lower-alpha">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-boost-63"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-boost_63-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_63-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_63-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_63-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_63-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_63-5"><sup><i><b>f</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Boost values (if available) are stated below the base value in <i>italic</i>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-texture_fill-64"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-texture_fill_64-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-texture_fill_64-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Texture fillrate is calculated as the number of <b>Texture Mapping Units</b> multiplied by the base (or boost) core clock speed.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-pixel_fill-65"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-pixel_fill_65-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-pixel_fill_65-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Pixel fillrate is calculated as the number of <b>Render Output Units</b> multiplied by the base (or boost) core clock speed.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FLOPS-66"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-FLOPS_66-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FLOPS_66-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Precision performance is calculated from the base (or boost) core clock speed based on a <a href="/wiki/Multiply%E2%80%93accumulate_operation#Fused_multiply–add" title="Multiply–accumulate operation">FMA</a> operation.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-GDDR5_transfer_rate-67"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-GDDR5_transfer_rate_67-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-GDDR5_transfer_rate_67-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">The effective data transfer rate of <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/GDDR5" title="GDDR5">GDDR5</a> is quadruple its nominal clock, instead of double as with DDR memory.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-cconfig-68"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-cconfig_68-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-cconfig_68-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Unified_shader_model" title="Unified shader model">Unified Shaders</a> : <a href="/wiki/Texture_mapping_unit" title="Texture mapping unit">Texture Mapping Units</a> : <a href="/wiki/Render_output_unit" title="Render output unit">Render Output Units</a></span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>
<p><br/>

<th>Bus type<br/>&amp; width

<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini" style="float: right;position: relative;top: -15px;right: 5px;"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:AMD_Radeon_Rx_200" title="Template:AMD Radeon Rx 200"><abbr title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:AMD_Radeon_Rx_200&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Template talk:AMD Radeon Rx 200 (page does not exist)"><abbr title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:AMD_Radeon_Rx_200&amp;action=edit"><abbr title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011085734" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="reflist reflist-lower-alpha">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-boost-70"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-boost_70-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_70-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_70-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_70-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_70-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_70-5"><sup><i><b>f</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Boost values (if available) are stated below the base value in <i>italic</i>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-texture_fill-71"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-texture_fill_71-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-texture_fill_71-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Texture fillrate is calculated as the number of <b>Texture Mapping Units</b> multiplied by the base (or boost) core clock speed.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-pixel_fill-72"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-pixel_fill_72-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-pixel_fill_72-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Pixel fillrate is calculated as the number of <b>Render Output Units</b> multiplied by the base (or boost) core clock speed.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FLOPS-73"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-FLOPS_73-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FLOPS_73-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Precision performance is calculated from the base (or boost) core clock speed based on a <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Fused_multiply%E2%80%93add" title="Fused multiply–add">FMA</a> operation.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-cconfig-74"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-cconfig_74-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-cconfig_74-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Unified_shader_model" title="Unified shader model">Unified Shaders</a> : <a href="/wiki/Texture_mapping_unit" title="Texture mapping unit">Texture Mapping Units</a> : <a href="/wiki/Render_output_unit" title="Render output unit">Render Output Units</a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-89"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-89">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The R9 285 utilizes loss-less colour compression which can increase effective memory performance (relative to GCN 1<sup>st</sup> gen and 2<sup>nd</sup> gen cards) in certain situations.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Hexus_R9_285_86-1"><a href="#cite_note-Hexus_R9_285-86">[44]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-88"><a href="#cite_note-88">[46]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-290/290X_base_clock-93"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-290/290X_base_clock_93-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-290/290X_base_clock_93-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Base clock of <b>R9 290</b> and <b>R9 290X</b> will maintain at 947 MHz and 1000 MHz before reaching 95 °C, respectively.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-92"><a href="#cite_note-92">[49]</a></sup></span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>
<p><br/>

<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini" style="float: right;position: relative;top: -15px;right: 5px;"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:AMD_Radeon_Rx_300" title="Template:AMD Radeon Rx 300"><abbr title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:AMD_Radeon_Rx_300&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Template talk:AMD Radeon Rx 300 (page does not exist)"><abbr title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:AMD_Radeon_Rx_300&amp;action=edit"><abbr title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011085734" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="reflist reflist-lower-alpha">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-boost-97"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-boost_97-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_97-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_97-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_97-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_97-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_97-5"><sup><i><b>f</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Boost values (if available) are stated below the base value in <i>italic</i>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-texture_fill-98"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-texture_fill_98-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-texture_fill_98-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Texture fillrate is calculated as the number of <b>Texture Mapping Units</b> multiplied by the base (or boost) core clock speed.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-pixel_fill-99"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-pixel_fill_99-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-pixel_fill_99-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Pixel fillrate is calculated as the number of <b>Render Output Units</b> multiplied by the base (or boost) core clock speed.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FLOPS-100"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-FLOPS_100-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FLOPS_100-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Precision performance is calculated from the base (or boost) core clock speed based on a <a href="/wiki/Multiply%E2%80%93accumulate_operation#Fused_multiply–add" title="Multiply–accumulate operation">FMA</a> operation. Double precision performance of <b>Hawaii</b> cards is 1/8 of single precision performance, for the other it is 1/16 of single precision performance.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-cconfig-101"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-cconfig_101-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-cconfig_101-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Unified_shader_model" title="Unified shader model">Unified Shaders</a> : <a href="/wiki/Texture_mapping_unit" title="Texture mapping unit">Texture Mapping Units</a> : <a href="/wiki/Render_output_unit" title="Render output unit">Render Output Units</a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-memory-108"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-memory_108-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The R9 380 utilizes loss-less color compression which can increase effective memory performance (relative to GCN 1<sup>st</sup> gen and 2<sup>nd</sup> gen cards) in certain situations.<sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">[<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed"><span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (June 2016)">citation needed</span></a></i>]</sup></span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>
<p><br/>

<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini" style="float: left;position: relative;top: -15px;right: 0px;"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:AMD_Radeon_Rx_400" title="Template:AMD Radeon Rx 400"><abbr title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:AMD_Radeon_Rx_400" title="Template talk:AMD Radeon Rx 400"><abbr title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:AMD_Radeon_Rx_400&amp;action=edit"><abbr title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011085734" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="reflist reflist-lower-alpha">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-boost-116"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-boost_116-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_116-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_116-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Boost values (if available) are stated below the base value in <i>italic</i>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-texture_fill-117"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-texture_fill_117-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Texture fillrate is calculated as the number of <b>Texture Mapping Units</b> multiplied by the base (or boost) core clock speed.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-pixel_fill-118"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-pixel_fill_118-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Pixel fillrate is calculated as the number of <b>Render Output Units</b> multiplied by the base (or boost) core clock speed.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FLOPS-119"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FLOPS_119-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Precision performance is calculated from the base (or boost) core clock speed based on a <a href="/wiki/Multiply%E2%80%93accumulate_operation#Fused_multiply–add" title="Multiply–accumulate operation">FMA</a> operation.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-cconfig-120"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-cconfig_120-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Unified_shader_model" title="Unified shader model">Unified Shaders</a> : <a href="/wiki/Texture_mapping_unit" title="Texture mapping unit">Texture Mapping Units</a> : <a href="/wiki/Render_output_unit" title="Render output unit">Render Output Units</a> and <a href="/wiki/Graphics_Core_Next#Compute_units" title="Graphics Core Next">Compute Units (CU)</a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-136"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-136">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/GlobalFoundries" title="GlobalFoundries">GlobalFoundries</a>' <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/14_nm" title="14 nm">14 nm</a> 14LPP <a href="/wiki/FinFET" title="FinFET">FinFET</a> process is <a href="/wiki/Second_source" title="Second source">second-sourced</a> from <a href="/wiki/Samsung_Electronics" title="Samsung Electronics">Samsung Electronics</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-GF-Samsung_135-0"><a href="#cite_note-GF-Samsung-135">[80]</a></sup></span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>
<p><br/>
</p>

<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini" style="float: right;position: relative;top: -15px;right: 5px;"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:AMD_Radeon_Rx_500" title="Template:AMD Radeon Rx 500"><abbr title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:AMD_Radeon_Rx_500" title="Template talk:AMD Radeon Rx 500"><abbr title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:AMD_Radeon_Rx_500&amp;action=edit"><abbr title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011085734" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="reflist reflist-lower-alpha">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-boost-142"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-boost_142-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_142-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_142-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Boost values (if available) are stated below the base value in <i>italic</i>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-texture_fill-143"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-texture_fill_143-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Texture fillrate is calculated as the number of <b>Texture Mapping Units</b> multiplied by the base (or boost) core clock speed.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-pixel_fill-144"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-pixel_fill_144-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Pixel fillrate is calculated as the number of <b>Render Output Units</b> multiplied by the base (or boost) core clock speed.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FLOPS-145"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FLOPS_145-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Precision performance is calculated from the base (or boost) core clock speed based on a <a href="/wiki/Multiply%E2%80%93accumulate_operation#Fused_multiply–add" title="Multiply–accumulate operation">FMA</a> operation.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-cconfig-146"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-cconfig_146-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Unified_shader_model" title="Unified shader model">Unified Shaders</a> : <a href="/wiki/Texture_mapping_unit" title="Texture mapping unit">Texture Mapping Units</a> : <a href="/wiki/Render_output_unit" title="Render output unit">Render Output Units</a> and <a href="/wiki/Graphics_Core_Next#Compute_units" title="Graphics Core Next">Compute Units (CU)</a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-153"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-153">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/GlobalFoundries" title="GlobalFoundries">GlobalFoundries</a>' <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/14_nm" title="14 nm">14 nm</a> 14LPP <a href="/wiki/FinFET" title="FinFET">FinFET</a> process is <a href="/wiki/Second_source" title="Second source">second-sourced</a> from <a href="/wiki/Samsung_Electronics" title="Samsung Electronics">Samsung Electronics</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-GF-Samsung_135-1"><a href="#cite_note-GF-Samsung-135">[80]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-560s-162"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-560s_162-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-560s_162-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">In October 2017 AMD branded an additional Polaris chip as "RX 560", although it features less shader and texture mapping units than the first released RX 560.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-169"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-169">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">GlobalFoundries' <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=12_nm&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="12 nm (page does not exist)">12 nm</a> 12LP process is based on Samsung's 14<span class="nowrap"> </span>nm 14LPP process.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-GF-Samsung_135-2"><a href="#cite_note-GF-Samsung-135">[80]</a></sup></span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>
<p><br/>
</p>

<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini" style="float: right;position: relative;top: -15px;right: 5px;"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:AMD_Radeon_RX_Vega" title="Template:AMD Radeon RX Vega"><abbr title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:AMD_Radeon_RX_Vega" title="Template talk:AMD Radeon RX Vega"><abbr title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:AMD_Radeon_RX_Vega&amp;action=edit"><abbr title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011085734" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="reflist reflist-lower-alpha">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-boost-170"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-boost_170-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_170-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_170-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Boost values (if available) are stated below the base value in <i>italic</i>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-texture_fill-171"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-texture_fill_171-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Texture fillrate is calculated as the number of <b>Texture Mapping Units</b> multiplied by the base (or boost) core clock speed.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-pixel_fill-172"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-pixel_fill_172-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Pixel fillrate is calculated as the number of <b>Render Output Units</b> multiplied by the base (or boost) core clock speed.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FLOPS-173"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FLOPS_173-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Precision performance is calculated from the base (or boost) core clock speed based on a <a href="/wiki/Multiply%E2%80%93accumulate_operation#Fused_multiply–add" title="Multiply–accumulate operation">FMA</a> operation.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-cconfig-174"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-cconfig_174-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Unified_shader_model" title="Unified shader model">Unified Shaders</a> : <a href="/wiki/Texture_mapping_unit" title="Texture mapping unit">Texture Mapping Units</a> : <a href="/wiki/Render_output_unit" title="Render output unit">Render Output Units</a> and <a href="/wiki/Graphics_Core_Next#Compute_units" title="Graphics Core Next">Compute Units (CU)</a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-179"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-179">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/GlobalFoundries" title="GlobalFoundries">GlobalFoundries</a>' <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/14_nm" title="14 nm">14 nm</a> 14LPP <a href="/wiki/FinFET" title="FinFET">FinFET</a> process is <a href="/wiki/Second_source" title="Second source">second-sourced</a> from <a href="/wiki/Samsung_Electronics" title="Samsung Electronics">Samsung Electronics</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-GF-Samsung_135-3"><a href="#cite_note-GF-Samsung-135">[80]</a></sup></span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>

<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini" style="float: left;position: relative;top: -15px;right: 0px;"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:AMD_Radeon_RX_5000" title="Template:AMD Radeon RX 5000"><abbr title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:AMD_Radeon_RX_5000" title="Template talk:AMD Radeon RX 5000"><abbr title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:AMD_Radeon_RX_5000&amp;action=edit"><abbr title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011085734" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="reflist reflist-lower-alpha">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-boost-192"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-boost_192-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_192-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-boost_192-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Boost values (if available) are stated below the base value in <i>italic</i>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-texture_fill-193"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-texture_fill_193-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Texture fillrate is calculated as the number of <b>Texture Mapping Units</b> multiplied by the base (or boost) core clock speed.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-pixel_fill-194"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-pixel_fill_194-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Pixel fillrate is calculated as the number of <b>Render Output Units</b> multiplied by the base (or boost) core clock speed.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FLOPS-195"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FLOPS_195-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Precision performance is calculated from the base (or boost) core clock speed based on a <a href="/wiki/Multiply%E2%80%93accumulate_operation#Fused_multiply–add" title="Multiply–accumulate operation">FMA</a> operation.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-cconfig-196"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-cconfig_196-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Unified_shader_model" title="Unified shader model">Unified Shaders</a> : <a href="/wiki/Texture_mapping_unit" title="Texture mapping unit">Texture Mapping Units</a> : <a href="/wiki/Render_output_unit" title="Render output unit">Render Output Units</a> and <a href="/wiki/Graphics_Core_Next#Compute_units" title="Graphics Core Next">Compute Units (CU)</a></span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>
<p><br/>
</p>

<th style="text-align:left;">Radeon RX 6900 XT<br/>(Navi 21) <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-amd-rx6000-comparison_237-2"><a href="#cite_note-amd-rx6000-comparison-237">[152]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-anandtech-rx6000_238-2"><a href="#cite_note-anandtech-rx6000-238">[153]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-techpowerup-rx6900xt_242-0"><a href="#cite_note-techpowerup-rx6900xt-242">[157]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-amd-rx6000-infcache_240-2"><a href="#cite_note-amd-rx6000-infcache-240">[155]</a></sup>
</th>
<td>December 8, 2020<br/><span class="nowrap">$999 USD</span>
</td>
<td>5120:320:128:80<br/>80 CU
</td>
<td>1825<br/><i>2250</i>
</td>
<td>584<br/><i>720</i>
</td>
<td>233.6<br/><i>288</i>
</td>
<td>37,376<br/><i>46,080</i>
</td>
